member.name: T:Terraria_Server.Projectile
member.summary: Projectile includes things like bullets, arrows, knives, explosives, boomerangs, and possibly ball/chain, orbs, and flamelash/spells.

member.summary: Whether the projectile is currently wet

member.name: F:Terraria_Server.Projectile.lavaWet
member.summary: Whether the projectile is currently immersed in lava

member.summary: Projectile's current 2-direction speed

member.summary: Degrees of rotation for projectile sprite

member.summary: Projectile's visibility, 255 == fully visible, 0 == invisible

member.summary: Index of owning player

member.summary: Amount of time left in the projectile's life cycle?

member.summary: Amount of time to delay sound. Unit unknown (likely milliseconds)

member.summary: Integer representing x direction of travel. Values unknown

member.name: F:Terraria_Server.Projectile.knockBack
member.summary: Amount of knockback the projectile causes

member.name: F:Terraria_Server.Projectile.penetrate
member.summary: How many entities the projectile can penetrate

member.summary: Projectile's index number in Main.projectile[]

member.name: F:Terraria_Server.Projectile.light
member.summary: Amount of light the projectile gives off

member.summary: Delay before striking an entity the projectile has already struck

member.summary: Miscellaneous text associated with the projectile. Only used in hardcore deaths and sign edits?

member.name: M:Terraria_Server.Commands.CommandParser.Tokenize(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Splits a command on spaces, with support for "parameters in quotes" and non-breaking\ spaces. Literal quotes need to be escaped like this: \" Literal backslashes need to escaped like this: \\ Returns the first token
member.param: Whole command line without trailing newline
An empty list to put the arguments in

member.name: T:Terraria_Server.Events.PlayerProjectileEvent
member.summary: Fired when player uses arrows, knives, tnt, bombs, grenades, guns, boomerangs. Possibly firelash, orb of light, ball/chain, etc. Be careful when using this to block projectiles. You could block something you don't want to.
